intro: Agrostophyllum carex, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along stream banks. It is native to regions in the southern United States and parts of Mexico. Agrostophyllum carex plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
